problem.p: A ball is launched from the origin, and undergoes projectile motion without rotating. Ignore air resistance.
While the ball is in the air, which of the following statements are true?

choicegroup.choice: The ball’s angular momentum is conserved, but only about the origin of the coordinate system.
The ball’s angular momentum is conserved regardless of the chosen reference point.
The ball’s angular momentum is not conserved about any stationary point on the Earth's surface.

problem.p: My answer to part 1 is justified because:

choicegroup.choice: The ball’s velocity is perfectly in line with the origin.
The ball can be treated as a point mass.
Only conservative external forces are involved.
External torque is applied on the ball.
